item.title: 2016-09-01: Module 1 introduction
item.description:
Interactivity & Module 1 Intro NI:B0308

Reading 1: Wensveen et al “Interaction Frogger: a Design framework to couple action and function through feedback”

  • What are the challenges of natural coupling when it comes to interaction design?
  • Pick a non-digital tool and attempt to identify its six aspects of coupling.
  • Try the same with an app or physical product with digital interactivity
  • How do you think this work is useful for the designer?
  • What is the contribution of the paper? What new knowledge is it adding?

item.title: 2016-08-29: Introduction day
item.description:
Introductions OR:B441

Reading 1: Schön - Design as Reflective Conversation with the Materials of the Design Situation

  • How does Schön describe the design knowledge?
  • Can you think of other examples of ‘knowing-in-action’ from your every day life?
  • For Schön, what form does a ‘design situation’ take, and how do we grasp it?
  • Briefly describe Schön’s account of seeing/moving/seeing
  • How do you think this process relates to sketching with digital materials, such as code?
  • How is progress made in a design situation, according to Schön?
